Close to 2 trolly lines 10 or so blocks above Union Square, we had a very enjoyable stay on the Club Lounge floor in this old office building with tons more character than a newer chain property. Rooms were standard size, moderninzed with the typical Ritz feel; room was quiet and bed very comfy. Pillows a little soft for my taste but quickly replaced with something firmer. Food presentations in the lounge were excellent, and "The Dining Room" which is their signature restaurant and which we had to ourselves for a group dinner with pairings, was outstanding. Front Desk seems understaffed as there was frequently a wait to speak with someone, and the Concierge located in the Club Lounge seemed to always be occupied, and couldn't perform check-out. Would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Work + pleasure trip at this hotel made it all leisure!”
Reviews.Author: et0607
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located in a great spot of San Francisco. We easily walked to Fisherman's Wharf, China Town starts around the block, Ghiardelli Square, and to wonderful restaurants and stores. We quickly drove to the Golden Gate bridge. This is a great location if you are going into Oakland or Berkley as we made it there within 20 minutes. The room was so beautiful and comfortable and the staff is exceptionally kind. My favorite staff was the valet and door crew! If you have children, the Teddy Bear Tea is a little expensive but every child leaves with a medium-sized super cute bear (not small like the website says, it's about 12" tall) and every kid was having so much fun!!! The parking was bout $75 a day (after tax) but you're going to pay in SF so at least the staff is great about it. If you just want to run to your room for a little while, they'll leave it at the door, or you can park it for the day and have them bring it around when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Ann-70
Reviews.Content: I spent three days at the san Francisco Ritz Carlton and had a great time. This hotel trully exempolifies the Ritz Carlton standards. I wish other RC hotels were as good as this one. The gym is located in the lower lever of the hotel and has all the necessary equipment to burn the calories that you will quickly gain in this beautiful city. The bartenders were very good and remeberd each person's drinks without asking. i will definately be back to this jewel and highly recommend to experienced travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go to wrong, it is the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: JayHTexas
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite and couldn't be happier. Nicest suite in an expensive city I have ever had. Doorman brought luggage up right away, and packages were delivered promptly to room. Room service on first night was great, timely and delicious. Had breakfast on the property first morning. Was excellent, but expensive as expectected($25 per)

Reviews.Title: “Puttin' me on at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: travelmikeVancouver
Reviews.Content: The place is magnificent. Breathtaking decor in the lobby and public spaces whisk you away into a palatial dream. Check in ran smoothly and we were within our room in moments after arrival. Our room, a "deluxe king", was beautifully decorated with antique reproductions in soft tones of buttery yellow and grey, and the bed was beyond comfortable. Our room faced the very European looking courtyard, and was whisper-quiet at night, though substantially smaller than the rooms across the hall which face a busy street. Rooms opposite the other side of the courtyard face a busy street with a cablecar line. While our stay was generally enjoyable, there are a few things you should know about this hotel. You are pretty much stuck there for breakfast, which is hideously expensive ($90 for 2), or you must face an alpine climb down and back up to the nearest coffee joint. Service in the grand lobby lounge was attentive, however for all they charged, not one staff member could locate a bran muffin for me even though they are listed as part of a room service breakfast. The cold buffet includes items you might not see in any other North American hotel, such as spicy, fatty cured meats, and platters of ripe cheese. There is a fairly endless array of rich and fatty foods, including sweet pastries. Healthier choices include cereal, packaged yogurt, and limited fresh fruit. The lunch and dinner menu here is very limited but hopefully the quality is better than the breakfast choices. When asked how our breakfast was, I told the server the omelette was not very good, he chuckled and walked away, charging full price. Unfortunately I cannot fully recommend the place at this time. Every morning at 9 a.m. on the dot an extremely annoying sharp drilling sound started and went pretty much non-stop both days, making a daytime snooze impossible. I asked THREE different staff members about the noise, none claimed to have any knowledge. At one point I was discussing the issue with a staffer in our hallway, who claimed he could hear nothing and knew nothing, even though we could both hear it very clearly even where we were having the discussion. One more piece of advice- if the concierge team suggests a restaurant, RUN THE OTHER WAY. Twice we were sent to sub-par eateries. Their top recommendation for Chinese food served inedible dim sum, the worst Peking Duck we've ever had, and chow mein so greasy it slithered off the plate practically of its own accord. Both places were complete tourist traps. The decor, rooms and service get high marks (the rooms are being refurbished which might have explained the ear-splitting noise in our room). If you have the money it's a grand experience overall, but do your homework as there are many top-quality hotels in San Fran. This one wants you to believe its the best, and with better food and a more-skilled Concierge team, it could be in the running. For now though, this grand dame needs a bit of work.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it could be”
Reviews.Author: pavlovsdawg
Reviews.Content: This hotel just isn't up to par to other luxury hotels. The sheets and bed are great and the room service was on time in the morning and the serivce staff was generally friendly. Also really liked the towels apples and water provided for joggers in the morning Here are a few of the problems: - The hotel did not have a foam set up for me and I am allergic to feathers - They make it very difficult for two people traveling together to book rooms near each other - The Carpets are in need of a deep clean. - Room Service at night was confused and befuddled and didn't get my order right twice. If it was someone else's choice I wouldn't object, but I wouldn't suggest this hotel to someone either.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: RatmanKL
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings - I mean who can really complain when he has the privilege to stay in a luxury hotel, and this Ritz Carlton certainly is one. However, you pay for luxury and luxury and adequate service are the benchmark then. I had mixed feelings about the service, the check-in and check-out procedure, the Internet billing, the Spa... Rooms are fine, nice furniture, carpet shows wear but that's a problem in all hotels if they are not brand new windows don't close that well so make sure you got the heating going but otherwise no complaints. Service was very good by the doormen - couldn't be better. A glass of Champagne was offered to me upon check-in and I certainly appreciate such. But check-in area itself is very small, there are only two working there so you have to wait for 20 minutes for check-in which is simply not acceptable. I saw people waiting at check-in, check-out all weekend; and, yes, property was fully booked. Check-in was ok, nobody showed me to the room, ok. But then it took almost an hour for the luggage to arrive and I had to call before it finally did arrive. The guy was apologetic and it's probably more a lack of staff than anything else. Again, not acceptable for a hotel of this standard. Tried to contact room service and frontdesk - busy all the time and when I finally got through the girl was less than friendly - very stressed out. Again, not acceptable for a hotel of this standard. That hotel of this standard charge when Courtyard doesn't is an old story and very deplorable. As long as they get away with it they will - am waiting for the luxury htel chain that stops and will patronise them... Anyway, I did connect with two different devices and got charged for both... They promised to remove the charge but did not. Tried to call in and talk to their billing departement. Told - again quite harshly - to call back later as they're busy. Again, not acceptable for a hotel of this standard. Went to SPA - booked Aromatherapy massage - girls insisted I had booked deep tissue - ok be it - an experience but it did hurt. But again, it's not acceptable for a hotel of this standard. Service in breakfast area was wonderful I have to say. So was the bar and the dining was simply delightful. All in all a mixed bag. My feeling is that hotel is under staffed when it's fully booked and some people (especially on phone etc.) are poorly trained to cope with the stress araising from that fact. In a time of rising unemployment Marriott should look at hiring I feel... Well, you're right I should worry about other things. I'll go back to stay with Mandarin Oriental wherever I can.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at a non-stuffy Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Debra1500
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant ,comfotable hotel, I was there for a seminar and stayed in the cheap rooms, but very comfortable and bed and linens in particular were super . Very quiet at night. Staff is super friendly, sometimes give you TMI when you are jet lagged and just want to crash. Skip the hotel fine dining--way overrated.

Reviews.Title: “$62 a night to park your car.”
Reviews.Author: byrd428
Reviews.Content: Great place. Everything was clean. Front desk was nice. Everyone was very helpful with directions...just be prepared for the parking tab

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place, poor response”
Reviews.Author: arentwealllucky
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Wednesday with a Saturday checkout for a leisure visit. The staff could not have been nicer - the concierge was great, the restaurants' wait staffs very attentive. We thorougly enjoyed the food at the restaurants on site. Our room and bath were attractively appointed. We had an inside view of a pretty courtyard, though I think a real view of San Francisco would have been nice, too. Our last night there, there were excrutiatingly disturbing and loud noises from the room next to us, for several hours. Made the night very worrisome and also impossible to sleep. After an hour and half and several calls, the front desk offered to change our room, but by then it was pushing 4 a.m., and we had to get up at 6:30 for our flights. The hotel should have at worst shushed the neighbors, at best kicked them out or changed their room. In the absence of doing that, we should have been comped for the last night. I emailed the hotel manager at the end of our vacation, and one of the managers had a representative of security call me. A situation handled poorly, but to security's credit, they will hopefully have a protocol in place to deal with this kind of issue properly, should it occur again. While the hotel's reaction didn't make us feel terrifically important to the hotel as guests, I have to say that the San Fran Ritz is a very nice place in and of itself. Would stil recommend it to others, but we won't be going back ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Welcomed back with a plate of truffles...”
Reviews.Author: drkish
Reviews.Content: Welcomed back with a plate of truffles and choc. covered strawberries. Awesome! Left my jewelery in our room before moving to the club level. Got a phone call as we were moving in, security brought all my jewelery to our room. I'm amazed and relieved that I even saw it again. I didn't know I had even left it and they had already called us.Best service, friendly and great food and wine. Will only stay here if I go to San Francisco again!

Reviews.Title: “When they tell you it's a great view . . .”
Reviews.Author: NH_Guy
Reviews.Content: We spent the better part of a week at this property, as part of a summer annual convention. At check-in we asked for a larger room, given the length of time we would be staying. Since a larger room was not in the offing (which later turned out to not be totally true), we were told that the view we were getting from the lesser room was well worth the trade-off. The only lesson here is to make sure that the young person at the front desk has actually been in the room before. Not. Well, perhaps if you stand on the ottoman and strain to look at the horizon . . . On second thought, looking out over the inner courtyard might have its advantages.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, exceptional service...hard to beat The Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Fokai
Reviews.Content: I've yet to visit a Ritz where I have found the service to be inconsistent with their mission statement. The SF property shines through with their wonderful service, from the doormen, to the bellmen, front desk personnel, concierge...you name it. The service is the main reason that I prefer this chain. The rooms are classic and very traditional. While I prefer a more modernistic design with earth tones and warm woods, the room's beauty is evident despite your taste in design. King bed, LCD, great view of the city and a very spacious room. Bathroom had twin sinks, tub/shower all in carrera marble. The hotel is in a great area, safe and close to neighborhood restaurants, shops. The Wharf, Chinatown, Little Italy is within walking distance (10-20 minutes depending on how slow or fast you walk). If walking isn't your thing, limos and/or cabs are at the ready. Overall, wonderful property close to SF city sites, or a day trip to Half Moon Bay, Sonoma, or Napa. Would certainly stay here again, in fact, looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “I really like the location of this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MATravelerBOS
Reviews.Content: The room rates are no bargains and the valet parking cost more than my daily rental rate, but hey this is a Ritz-Carlton and I didn't pick the hotel for its value. Everything about this hotel is top notch, and the location near Union Square, Chinatown and cable car lines is very convenient. Great dinner recommendations from the concierge. Very restful and satisfying stay. I will definitely stay here again, but park my rental elsewhere :).

Reviews.Title: “Apparently you need the club level for the 5 star reviews!”
Reviews.Author: caflygrl
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Ritz Hotel. My husband and I have stayed at a few Intercontinentals and decided to see if the Ritz lived up to its 5 star rating! Location is decent just a few blocks away from Union Square. While the hotel building has really great architecture, it is not very tall so you really don't get any view of the skyline from any room. The lobby is quite opulent with marble everywhere you look. It makes me think of "old money" rich rather than the more trendy Intercon. My husband had dropped his bags earlier in the day and we checked in later that night. They brought his bags to the room but oops, only brought 1 instead of 2 bags. They had to go back and retrieve the second one. Our room was on the 5th floor which is only 1 floor above the lobby. It was somewhat close to the elevators and also the doors to the rooms seemed very close together. At night, when our neighbors would open the doors to their rooms, I kept thinking someone was coming in to ours! Also we could hear some street noises outside the window though we didn't have our windows open. Unfortunately, we also appeared to have been put in a wedding block so when the other guests came back late at night, we got to hear their loud voices floating through the halls. It only woke me up once (I was beat!) but apparently my husband was up all night. The rooms were nice with flat screen tv and dvd player. Also an iHome which was great for plugging in the iPod. However I will point out we moved to the JW Marriott down the street after the Ritz and their flat screen tv was twice as big AND there was Bose theater system. We appeared to have received a turn down service on Fri night (we stayed 2 nights) with the blanket turned down and classical music playing. We didn't receive that on Sat night though even though we came back somewhat late. We did enjoy the complimentary bottles of water and coffee maker in the room. I always enjoy the little extras in the bathroom. In this case, my favorite was the ring holder. For a 5 star hotel, I had really hoped for more though like some fancy soaps and giant plush towels. Aside from the embroidered logos, the towels were smallish and scratchy. I didn't even bother swiping the shampoos and soaps! Some other reviews talk of fancy Bulgari soaps... must only be on the Club Level. Also, water pressure wasn't great but at least the bathroom was spacious. Some reviewers talk of outstanding service but I thought it was average. Yes, the concierge gave us maps... that's what they are supposed to do! Sometimes the doors were opened for us when we came/went but sometimes they were too busy talking to each other to help us out and certainly no one greeted us by name or went out of their way to say hello. I was glad to have at least tried out the Ritz and thankfully, I was not paying for the room. I think in general though I felt my stays at other less expensive hotels were just as good. For example, Hampton Inn has really comfy beds and fresh baked cookies with free breakfast and even Holiday Inn's nowadays have updated marble bathrooms! At least if we had a #1 location and awesome views, I could see the reason for the expense but this time, I couldn't justify it. Glad to see at least a couple other reviewers really loved it though.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Service”
Reviews.Author: Sarac_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz in San Francisco in July. It was my Birthday, and generally we go away, most times over seas. The Ritz exceeded expectations. Due to my husband's work schedule I flew in 1 day early. My husband called the hotel and asked & paid for the following:there were two ladies at the hotel who put 20+ beautiful balloons, a bottle of champagne, and roses, to greet me in my room with beautful classical music. It was a wonderful greeting. Thank you Brooke, and please forgive me, I do not remember the other name. The hotel is in a great location, wonderful beds & linens, walking distance to Union Square, SF MOMA etc.... Todd greeted me by name, every time he saw me. Laurel was very charming and engaging. Gym is well equiped, did not have to wait for treadmill. Hotel is recently renovated, nice ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommend the Club Level Floor!”
Reviews.Author: Scarlett74
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel albeit at the top of a very steep hill! The best part for us was the club level lounge (it felt very exclusive). The concierge on the desk were incredibly helpful and friendly â€“ they recommended and made dinner reservations at a local restaurant in China Town. There are soft drinks, tea and coffee and biscuits available all day. With a great breakfast selection and from early evening there are drinks (including cocktails and champagne) and snacks. The snacks were fantastic, if we didnâ€™t have a dinner reservation we stayed in the hotel and just snacked on the great canapÃ©s.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: kazpalms
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here - the last time was 3 years ago when we just booked standard rooms (which were fantastic). This time we decided to treat ourselves to 2 club level rooms. Things got off to a rather shaky start when we arrived to find that the hotel was overbooked and so our rooms were not longer available. However the duty manager, Andy, came up with a rather brilliant alternative - he put us in the presidential suite! We just had to wait until Tom Cruise checked out! This was a seriously gorgeous room with a massive balcony complete with numerous loungers and tables and chairs. The room even has a grand piano and full kitchen. If I were to nit pick it would only be the fact that we had wanted us all to have proper beds to sleep in but this room only has one king bed. One of the children slept on a sofabed and the other on a rollaway in the lounge area. Both were comfortable but not the "proper" beds we had booked. However this room more than made up for that minor irritation. Plenty of hanging space for clothes, an enormous master bath surrounded by candles and a full dining room. Shame we did not know anyone in San Francisco - we could have had quite a party in that space! The best, best bit though is the club level lounge. If you can afford to to it, the you should experience it. It is quite the best club lounge we have ever been to. The concerieges on the desk there are incredibly helpful and friendly. The food is amazing and plenty of it. There are soft drinks and tea and coffee available all the time, along with amazing fresh baked cookies. The breakfast selection is extensive and delicious and from early evening there is a huge array of drinks (including cocktails and champagne) with fantastic snacks available to enjoy. It really does have the feel of an exclusive club, down to the fact that only people on the club level floors can access it. Your room key has to be put into a slot in the lift to there. The main hotel is in great shape still. The main rooms are beautiful and imposing. The concerieges on the desk downstairs are a mine of information and suggested some great restaurants for us. It is an easy walk downhill to the huge array of amazing shops in San Francisco. Little more tiring on the way back up though. Both times I have stayed I have been to a flamboyant and very interesting man called Bibo for a shampoo and blowdry. You should go just for the experience of meeting him. Lovely man, full of energy and joie de vivre. Not cheap but he does a good job. His salon is a short walk from the hotel. Well done Ritz Carlton. The level of service has remained constant since our last visit and this one surpassed the last! I would heartily recommend this hotel and would certainly suggest that you try the club level experience here if you can. We hope to be back!

Reviews.Title: “great hub for SF touring”
Reviews.Author: AusTravel2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz with our teenage boys, it was the hub for our adventures around the SF area. The hotel was great, rooms spacious, service top shelf, the bonus was the indoor heated pool which was a great retreat after a long day of site seeing. Chinatown is on your doorstep as is the downtown shopping precinct. The Cable car is a block away. Nothing is more than a 10 dollar cab ride away. A great value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gcullen
Reviews.Content: I am staying here overnight for business. Can usually count on the ritz having top notch service and accomidations - not so in san francisco. Service has been poor except the bell hop (they are excellent). Room was dirty with food on the floors and a liquid stains on the desk. Rooms with connecting room doors are paper thin. the room next to me has the tv blasting as I'm writting this (I'm in room 561, ask for another room of you are given). Next trip trying the four seasons. Greg

Reviews.Title: “Great Club Level”
Reviews.Author: EVolFan
Reviews.Content: The club level at a Ritz-Carlton is a savvy traveler's secret, but this property exceeds most others by the attention given to each guest by the club concierge and his staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, of course”
Reviews.Author: interviewtraveler
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of a conference that was there, which gave us a discounted room rate, but this trip was mainly for vacation. The hotel is above the Stockton tunnel, so if you're walking up Stockton, you'll need to take the stairs to get there. The hotel employees are extremely professional and nice. Because of our room rate, our room was on the same floor as the lobby, but with the hills, you still get a decent view. The spacious room was nicely decorated, and the bathroom is nice as well with his and hers sinks. I also appreciated the little things like complimentary water bottles and little chocolates. The location is right next to Chinatown, about a 15 minute walk down to Union Square and the Powell MUNI/BART station, and about a 20 minute walk up to Pier 39. Valet parking is pretty expensive, so it's beneficial to be walking distance to so many attractions. We had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “suites on the Club levels are best”
Reviews.Author: jscdjjk
Reviews.Content: The one bedroom suite I stayed on the Club level was wonderful. It was huge and very comfortable. Considering the hotel was in the middle of San Francisco, I was surprised by its size, which is probably close to 1000sf. Another pleasant surprise was the quality and the variety of the foods provided in the Club lounge throughout the day. Will definitely go back with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Says No Room at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: Michele866
Reviews.Content: Booked king hotel room on corporate level at Ritz Carlton. When I arrived after a long flight, a gentleman meets me outside and tells me that they have no rooms available. He says he will have his car take me to the Mandarin Oriental. Takes awhile to get to the Mandarin in San Francisco rush hour. The hotel is not in as nice of a neighborhood as the Ritz Carlton, also not as close to the deposition I had scheduled for the next morning. I get there and they put me in a room with 2 twin beds. I ask for a King and they say they have none available to me because the Ritz didn't book a king for me. You pay extra for a decent hotel experience and get treated with less courtesy than if you'd booked a room at the Holiday Inn. One has to wonder when exactly the Ritz knew it wouldn't have a room available to me and why it didn't contact me earlier so that I could make other arrangements and wouldn't be scrambling around at the last minute, cramped in a twin bed in a hotel whose decor and surroundings are not of my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience-caring and professional staff.”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel12387
Reviews.Content: We booked through WhataHotel as we have had outstanding success with this website--they deliver what they promise. We were upgraded to a Jr. suite with a living room--the bathroom had two sinks,separate area with a door for the toilet, lots of marble, and great bath products. I asked for bubble bath and they brought two champagne glasses with bubble bath and bath salts! WhataHotel lists 'continental breakfast' for this hotel but we received enough daily credit to have the full hot breakfast buffet. The staff at this hotel sets it apart from other luxury hotels--many have worked there since it opened. We received wonderful dinner suggestions and were able to 'get in' at booked-up restaurants. We hated to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Bring your wallet!”
Reviews.Author: JMB2003
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2007, loved it so much, came back for more! We had another excellent stay. Room was beautiful, and gotta love the Ritz cleanliness. Pros: +Excellent location in SF--close to Chinatown and Union Sq. shopping, cable cars, and just a 10 minute taxi ride to Wharf or AT&T Park. +The rooms are amazing--I would book a larger room if you can. Their standard room is a bit small, but it is a city hotel. +Love their lobby lounge +Also loved their breakfast options. +Plenty of bottled waters--in the room, in the a.m. in the lobby. Some Cons: +If you rent a car, the valet parking is steep ($71/day). +Some areas of the Ritz are very good (concierge, gift shop, room service). The Spa continues to disappoint me--surly desk clerk (she practically scolded me for being 20 minutes early for my appt.--god forbid, I just want to relax and read a magazine), so-so service, big price tag. +Valet service is also a disappointment--they only seem to be available when you are checking in or leaving (they must smell the guaranteed tips). We always hailed our own cab or grabbed one right in front of the hotel without their help. When you want to treat yourself, come here!!

Reviews.Title: “If you're wearing an Argyle sweater, kahki shorts above the knee and loafers w/ no socks, you'll fit right in!”
Reviews.Author: flybyday8
Reviews.Content: I took my nanny and kids (6 & 8 yr old boys) to the Ritz for a long weekend to enjoy the magic of San Francisco. Mission accomplished. The Ritz is in a great location - in the heart of Nob Hill, just a block away from the Powell Street trolley and around the corner from Chinatown. Rooms were clean - and nice. There was a DVD player which was very appreciated! Kids really enjoyed the indoor pool and I enjoyed the jacuzzi after a day of trekking up the SF hills. I would not go back there with children again. Perhaps I was hyper-sensitive about my rambunctious boys, but we just didn't fit in. There is definitely snobbery in the air; down-to-earth, the Ritz is not. There is a balance between welcoming hospitality that does not compromise quality - and an overdone level of "service" that is forced down by management rather than a genuine expression. The Ritz on the Nob was the latter. Parking to the tune of $71 a day is ludicrous. Unless they were going to spit-shine my car daily, perform a tune-up, and leave a chocolate on the driver's seat, there is no way I was going to throw that kind of money down the drain (or a cement garage). So....I parked at St. Mary's Square just a block down the way, where they charge $32/day - but if you go on the weekend and time it just right, you'll only pay $7 for Saturday and $7 for Sunday. That's what I did - and my car didn't know the difference. Hail to St. Mary! Between that and the wi-fi charge, yes, I did feel like I was nickel and dimed. C'mon....do you really need to charge $44 for wi-fi, just because you "can"? I mean really, Ritz....it just leaves a bad taste. If you are going there as a couple to splurge for the weekend, and enjoy San Francisco, then go for it. Just be aware that there are men in short khaki shorts, pink Polo shirts w/ argyle sweaters draped over the shoulders....and shiny loafers w/ no socks - that are sipping tea in the lobby....legs crossed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel--excellent club lounge and staff, but room layout/utilisation slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: zwgc2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1-Bedroom suite for two days (3 people). We decided to get lounge access for USD$100 per room/night. Staff was truly welcoming and helpful. The room we stayed in, at least we thought, was disappointing. The use of space was poor--a "mini" corridor leading from the room entrance into the living room which was useless. The living room was spacious but the plasma TV was way too small to be viewed from the sofa and chairs--spacious area but not well used. Excellent master bedroom though. The club lounge was wonderful--food presentation was of the highest quality, although the morning offerings could be expanded to include more hot food items. The design of the lounge is very comfortable and cosy. Definitely worth the money to book into a club level guestroom. The location of the hotel is just a couple of blocks' walk from market street downtown, although I must warn on your way back the roads are very steep. All in all an excellent hotel, but the the room /space utilisation for the suite is disappointing and not something that can be changed overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Clean, Great Staff/Service”
Reviews.Author: NapaSteveV
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this Ritz property and the novelty has somewhat worn off, allowing me to see the hotel for what it is: A dated gem. Every bit of four stars, but not a five-star property in my opinion. Compared to most alternatives in SF, which also tend to be older properties, this remains a best bet.

Reviews.Title: “"WOW" service from Two Ritz Carlton Hotels”
Reviews.Author: MissBonie
Reviews.Content: After checking room availability at Half Moon Bay and the San Francisco locations, we decided to experience the City by the Bay. This is a short tale of Two Ritz's. Long story short, we wanted tickets to Beach Blanket Babylon and called the concierge, Valerie Seyler. Not a problem, she was able to get us seats for the next evening. Only one small snag, Valerie couldn't find us registered at the hotel for confirmation. It finally dawned on me that I had dialed the Half Moon Bay location instead of where we were staying at Nob Hill. After feeling like an idiot, Valerie was so gracious and sincere that she could accomodate our request. We were thrilled with out stay at the Ritz. For the class of hotel, we can't understand why it is so far down on the Trip Advisor list. It was expensive, but worth every penny. Management checked if we needed anything each day and went "above and beyond" our expectations. Never were we not greeted at the door by any staff member with a smile and a kind word. The location is a couple of blocks from Chinatown and a block from the cable car lines. We bought a day pass for the cable cars and found out there is a better day pass that you can use for trolleys, buses AND cable cars. Don't miss going to "Sears" for breakfast. And, we went to the Ocean Pearl Restaurant in Chinatown which came highly recommended. NOTE: Valet parking is VERY expensive...$62.00 per day. Self park down the hill for $32.00 day.

Reviews.Title: “So incredibly stuffy”
Reviews.Author: scanner96
Reviews.Content: This hotel was like a funeral parlor. Not sure that they have even seen guests under the age of 70 in at least 10 years, judging by the rude behavior and attitudes of the staff. They are indifferent to guests unless you arrive with white hair and in your granddad's cadillac. Quite a disappointment. This hotel chain would be wise to court younger guests given their clearly aging demographic. As for the hotel, the quality was so-so - definitely not as nice as a Four Seasons. The furniture in the room was chipped and old; the pool downstairs not very well maintained; and the overall feeling and vibe were staid, stoic and oh-so-boring. If you are on business, this hotel might be for you. But if you are looking for a luxury leisure experience in the city, I would suggest any other hotel but this one. And as I mentioned, if you are anything but 90, heterosexual and stuffy, this place is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated luxury”
Reviews.Author: SethLBoston
Reviews.Content: While on a recent trip to San Francisco, we stayed at the Ritz-Carlton mainly because it was significantly cheaper than other modern, updated hotels near Union Square and SOMA. As it is a Ritz-Carlton, it is a beautiful, comfortable property. However, many of the staff and patrons tended to be very stuffy and unfriendly, which is a detriment to the hotel's competitiveness in the San Francisco luxury accommodations market. Our room was very clean, comfortable, but predictably dated and small. Having stayed at other nice properties in San Francisco and several other urban locations, it was a bit of a disappointment. The Four Seasons, W, Intercontinental or many of the city's lovely boutique properties are certainly a better option for both room quality and attention to detail. The staff and features of the hotel's spa were very nice, and worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yasmen108
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Staff is realy nice and can organize anything for you (tours,restaurant,car) and the apartament is top of the range!! I had a very enjoyable stay at The Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Food”
Reviews.Author: johnbone1
Reviews.Content: What can i say, the ritz is unbelievable, the best memory of my trip to san fransisco is this accommodation! Great friendly staff i must say

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rate and phenomenal experience”
Reviews.Author: mnbaby
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay in San Francisco with business colleagues that were arriving from the Midwest and China. The Ritz Carlton had a holiday weekday deal that was simply amazing- it was actually less expensive than our corporate rate at much lesser San Francisco hotels. From the moment that we stepped into the lobby, the smell of wonderous holiday was steeped in the place. Everyone seemed to know who I was when I was greeted by the staff- a hallmark of excellent service. mThe concierge helped procure great dinner reservations for our entire group. The work out facilities were fabulous and the beds were dreamy. Oversize bathroom rounded out the mix. I couldn't have asked for more. It was within walking distance of our first meetings and easy walk to the restaurant we wanted to eat at for dinner. I would stay at this or another Ritz any time I get the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: CharmainLisenbee
Reviews.Content: We were visiting from Miami/FL and we had such a great time. Our son, who is 4, did not get a lot of activities to do there, but we managed to keep him busy at all times. We would definitely go back, next time maybe just my wife and I. Charmain Lisenbee

Reviews.Title: “Strong Ritz Performer - Good Representative of Ritz Chain”
Reviews.Author: Courchevel
Reviews.Content: The San Francisco Ritz delivers the brand nicely. The staff is attentive, prompt and courteous. The environment is pleasant and common areas are well maintained and appropriately formal. Overall the lobby exudes a formal quiet but welcoming and warm ambiance . I personally appreciate the intimate lobby and 1st floor lounge/restaurant. Although our visit was over a holiday weekend, Presidents Day weekend 2010, the hotel never felt busy or crowded. Our room was a standard king. There is plenty of room for two people and a large bathroom. Room and bathroom seem slightly above average for a typical Ritz establishment. As with most Ritz's, the bed was outstanding. For business - this is a great location, for leisure the location is fine as well. Within walking distance of downtown proper and cabs are easy to come by. As a comparison, the Ritz location is much better than the Four Seasons (my opinion). Overall the hotel delivered exactly what I wanted - upscale elegance, a quiet escape from the crowds, attentive friendly service, comforatable room with large bathroom and a professional staff. The concierge handled shipping numerous cases of wine back home for me, with minimal effort on my part and the house car was made available on numerous occasions. The hotel added to our weekend experience. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton, like the weather, is hot and cold”
Reviews.Author: Chopalua
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was to celebrate my husband's birthday. We confirmed our reservation a couple days prior and advised the hotel of this. Upon check in, we received a specially made music CD reminiscent of the music for the birthday year, however it was off by 20 years! We mentioned this to the receptionist, but she laughed and did nothing to correct it. We found this most interesting because my husband is a Marriott Gold member (Platinum for many years) so they his bio already on file. Once in the room, we were treated with the usual friendly service, but once the bellhop left, so did the concern for the guest. Pros: 1. Excellent housekeeping. We tipped the housekeeper because not only was the room cleaned promptly and efficiently in the morning, the evening turndown service was good, but see Cons. 2. Location. There is a trolley stop right outside the hotel, which is nice if you are tired of walking up and down the hills. If you're a morning exerciser, you will find how close Chinatown and Little Italy are from the hotel for your morning stroll/run. 3. Room furnishing. While the room was small, it was comfortable and clean. The furniture was positioned in the typical hotel format, but the pieces were better than average hotel grade. The sheets, pillows, linens, fabrics were all of better quality. 4. Quick valet. Cons: 1. Turndown service. When the room was turned down, it was great. However, I'm not sure why RC thought that their guests preferred late service. Consistently, the turndown service was very late in the evening. One night we had already returned and retired for the evening only to hear a knock at the door at 11pm by the housekeeper to come in. She was surprised when we refused a couple times because we were already in our PJs. Very odd! 2. Customer service. When you call down to the Concierge desk in the morning for assistance on your rental car, you are put on hold for 18 min. Yes, we timed it as we vigorously were on another phone and online trying to resolve the situation with Hertz. I decided to go down to the lobby to speak with the Concierge desk in person. When no one was there, I asked the receptionist what was going on. She stated that the Concierge doesn't come in until 9am! Think this would have been communicated somehow through their telephone system or hotel operator? Overall, our the property was very nice, considering it is a very old building in a weather environment that can be hard on structures. However, customer service was hot at the beginning, addressing you by name as you checked in, but sharply declined to a cool indifference once they charged your card and checking out would be too much of a hassle. I'm almost certain we would not stay here again, since there are so many other properties of same or higher caliber that are worth their value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: momwith2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time. We thought the service was very attentive, friendly, and professional. The hotel itself was spotless and beautiful. The central location was easy to get around to most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: attytrav.
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz for 2 nights (sun-mon) for a conference. The conference room rate was 199 a night. My experience with the staff was fantastic and the opposite of some prior reviews. I got in several hours before check in and was immediately placed in an enormous, beautiful corner room overlooking the street on the seventh floor. For the rate I was paying I was very impressed. The staff during check in could not have been more helpful and accommodating. room service was fast and very efficient. My room was cleaned at least once a day plus turn down service. The room was immaculate, the bed extremely comfortable. If I can get a rate like this in the future I will always stay at this hotel. I just cant understand the poor reviews as staff was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Premium Hotel but Luxury prices”
Reviews.Author: SBawa
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, close to Union Aquare. Very good food, but RC, New York is much better

Reviews.Title: “Poor Attitudes”
Reviews.Author: kobekeith
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for one night on my way back to Japan on an over-night lay-over and the desk staff treated me terribly. Checking me in was an inconvenience for the desk jockey. I'm put off with how chatty service people are in the States but the people at this hotel were dead fish. I think that they forgot that they are actually working there and NOT spending a few hundred dollars a night to be there. I guess I am used to the luxury service at the Ritz in Osaka, Japan and should not have expected the same from bitter customer service people stuck in a rut in the States. It's too bad because the hotel looks nice and is in a good location. I will stay in the Mandarin when I pass through again in 3 months.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: mkeller2
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decide to do a weekend getaway to San Francisco. We were thrilled when we found a great package on Expedia that included two nights at the Ritz and airfare. I've never stayed at a Ritz Carlton, but have stayed at comparable hotels, including the Mandarin Oriental, so I expected the same level of service that one would expect from a luxury hotel. When I booked the trip, I selected a room with two double beds, and the confirmation that later received indicated that we had indeed reserved that type of room. Upon arrival however, the person at the front desk told us that they didn't have anymore rooms with two double beds, only rooms with one king bed. I replied that I didn't reserve a room with one bed, and asked if there was anything else she could do. After a couple of back and forths, she replied that she would be happy to have a cot brought up to the room, so that we could have an extra bed. My friend immediately said no. Being offered at cot at the Ritz Carlton???? That's like paying for a luxury room and being told that you have to sleep on the couch. Obviously, our conversation with her was going nowhere, so I asked to speak with the manager. He informed us that they didn't have anymore rooms with two double beds. I showed him the printed confirmation, and after looking a bit flustered, he replied that rooms booked on Expedia cannot be guaranteed. He said that we needed to call after making the reservation to confirm that we could get the actual room we had booked. After more back and forths, he finally replied that he indeed did have a room with two double beds, but it was on the 1st floor. I said that although that wasn't my preference, if that was the best he could do, then I guess we have no choice. After yet more back and forths, he finally replied that a room on the 7th floor would be available at 2:00. Note that we had arrived early, at 11:30, and were certainly not expecting to check in until later. We simply wanted to check our bags until the room was ready, and in the meantime walk around a bit. I said that was great. I thanked him many times for his help, but he never once acknowledged my appreciation. Also note, that I was at all times during this transaction quite calm and courteous. I never got nasty, but also wasn't willing to back down. Also, why did I have to jump through hoops to get a room the I had (a) reserved in the first place and (b) would be available later that day anyway. The whole experience left a very bad taste in my mouth. The room itself was fine. Clean for the most part, although we came back later in the day to find a strange comb, etc., sitting on the nightstand. The wallpaper was peeling in several places, and housekeeping kept forgetting to clear the used coffee from the maker and replenish the bar with new supplies. Overall, not what I would expect from a luxury hotel. I won't be staying at a Ritz Carlton again, especially when there are so many other great hotels that offer better rooms and phenomenal service. I guess they just didn't want to deal with customers who got a great rate on Expedia. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty But Flawed”
Reviews.Author: BrynMawrBK
Reviews.Content: My husband and two daughters recently spent a four-day weekend at the Ritz-Carlton San Francisco. It is a handsome building in a good location, but several annoyances make us wonder whether it's time to change our allegiance to the Ritz brand. We had wanted to stay at the San Francisco Ritz for some time and booked a one-bedroom suite on the Club level so that breakfast, lunch and snacks would be readily available in the Club lounge, primarily for our kids (easier than going to a restaurant for every meal). When making the reservation I was very specific that there would be four of us in the suite, stated the ages of our kids, and explained that we needed a pullout couch for one child and a rollaway for the other. I was told the nightly rate for the suite when I reserved, and nothing was said about any extra charges due to the number of people in the suite (keep reading). First problem: after confirming three times in advance that our suite would have a separate pullout couch and a rollaway bed in the living room, AND that they would be made up and ready when we arrived because we were getting in late, we were taken to a suite with no pullout couch at all and no rollaway in sight. After a couple of phone calls, we were finally moved to a one-bedroom suite that met the description of what I had reserved, but it was very late and we were exhausted. It wasn't a pleasant beginning to our stay. Next problem: upon reading the Club level "welcome letter", we learned for the first time that only three people per suite could partake of the Club lounge food and beverage; any additional guests would have to pay $50 per day. At no time during the reservation process was this mentioned to me despite my specifically advising the reservations personnel that there would be four guests in the one-bedroom suite. This additional charge therefore effectively raised our nightly room rate by $50 per night, to a rate we had not agreed to. We immediately discussed this with the Club manager and the reservations manager, and asked that someone get back to us with their determination on the matter. No one ever did, but upon our checkout, the $50 per day additional charge had been included in our bill. On this point, it's the principle of the thing. If that's their policy, they should tell you when you make your reservation. We had paid a significant additional amount to stay on the Club floor already, and ended up paying $200 extra on top of that (for a 12-year-old girl who doesn't eat much). Housekeeping problem: on two out of the four days of our visit, our room was never made up. We left the hotel before 9 a.m. each day and returned just before dinner time, to find no clean towels and the suite uncleaned. Each time this resulted in housekeeping rushing to our suite to make it up at the same time that we were trying to shower and get changed to go out to dinner. It is a mystery to us why this should happen even once...but twice is ridiculous. Finally, more housekeeping issues: throughout our stay, plates of half-eaten food sat outside rooms on our hallway, on the floor and on furniture, for more than a day at a time. It was, frankly, disgusting. Why wasn't this cleaned up? To see this at a hotel at the level of the Ritz is unbelievable. On the plus side, our suite was lovely, and the staff were uniformly pleasant and helpful. Still, the stay was overall a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected and more...”
Reviews.Author: JCarlson1
Reviews.Content: After extensive research of the various upscale hotels in San Francisco, I chose the Ritz Carlton based on other reviews and the great location. This hotel was one of the few I have experienced that is as beautiful and stunning in person as it is in the pictures. All of the staff were extremely courteous and professional. This hotel is the true symbol of elegance, and would be my only choice in San Francisco. We were upgraded to a suite upon check in and the room was amazing. There are not enough good things I can say about this hotel, but I highly recommend it and it made my vacation amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but pretty wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TarynfromHollywood
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton is located conveniently to all the hotspots in SF. It is a very luxurious five-star hotel. I demand luxury at every hotel I stay at and this meets my standards. The service was great. Everyone was friendly. Worth every penny. very luxurious. :)

Reviews.Title: “It depends what you expect... we expected more!”
Reviews.Author: HighMountain18
Reviews.Content: We had a nice Suite in a quiet setting. The atmosphere is fine, gravelike at the restaurants. We celebrated NYE at this hotel "Glitz at the Ritz" within a 3 night stay. The selection for breakfast was just average, service can't match upscale 5* competitors . Dinner selection and qualiy is far away of what SF has to offer. This hotel reaches and offers the AAA 5* standards. So there is no reason to mention those. Yes, the Ritz-Carlton SF is ok incl. pricing - depending what you expect. Good service we experienced worldwide is whenever you get more than you expect. Friendliness is one side, capability and experience in hosting guests the other. The Ritz-Carlton has a high reputation which SF not fulfills. Therefore we will try a competitor next time at SF.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, no big frills, calm and just as expected”
Reviews.Author: Sealover2008
Reviews.Content: One of the good properties on the Ritz Carlton roll, with great quiet location, great rooms. 5 star quality as expected, nothing on outstanding side but again this is San Francisco, not a resort type of property. Restaurant is very good. We also enjoyed the quietness, since there are absolutely no crowds of tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a couples get-away”
Reviews.Author: Kim_BC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 nights at the Ritz Carleton, in celebration of our 25th anniversary. What a a wonderful experience we had at this hotel! The building itself is stunning--very elegant and well-appointed and the service we received was second to none, including some special touches by staff in honor of our anniversary. The staff at the concierge desk were very knowledgeable and accommodating and recommended the perfect dinner spot for our anniversary dinner (The Fleur de Lys Restaurant--if you love fine French food and are looking for something special, I would highly recommend this restaurant). We were looking for something special for our anniversary and found it at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: zmazouzi
Reviews.Content: For the moment I arrived, I could feel the difference in the service of the Ritz Carlton. I was greeted by name by the bell boy (he got the name off my luggage when he took it out of the car), another Gentleman offered me champagne while I was waiting to check in, the rooms are luxurious and the location is close to everything. just a few minutes from the cable car stop which can take you to Fisherman's wharf and Chinatown or you can go in the opposite direction and head downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Jumbocat
Reviews.Content: We returned to this hotel for it's excellent central location and splendid slightly colonial feel. Not a typical modern luxury hotel. This time it didn't quite meet our previous expectations. The courtyard restaurant was closed, all the staff seemed only interested in fawning over one to gain tips (except the cleaning staff who were lovely) and the prices (in a recession) seemed even more excessive. Nonetheless, it does still have quite a fine stately feel about it, if you don't mind paying a premium.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and convenient hotel, good service.”
Reviews.Author: danielmaui
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights last week in a standard room and were provided a high floor (7th) corner room with a view and had no street-noise issues at all. Check-in was smooth and quick, even at 1 PM, 2 hours before normal check-in. A small box of chocolates and card was in the room for a belated birthday. We had an almost 2-year old with us, which was noted at time of reservation (because we did not want a crib but rather a king bed since she sleeps with us). We did receive a king bed, which I thought was very nice, but no special amenities of any kind for the baby, which some properties provide. A bellman brought our luggage very quickly and offered at that time to have the windows baby-proofed by having the handles removed (we opted not to). The minibar is stocked full of your typical drinks, and a small drawer above it contains other items such as playing cards, panty-hose, spare undergarments, jelly beans, a nice pocket-size map of the area, all available for sale. If you would like a mini-fridge instead, it will cost you $25/day. A nice coffee/tea kit is provided complimentary and is (usually) restocked at turn-down service, which happened every evening. In-room Internet is available via Ethernet at the desk, or via Wi-Fi however Wi-Fi did not work for our room. Connectivity to the access point was easy, but not to the router beyond that so no IP was acquirable. Not a big deal for us since we used our notebook at the desk, and I suppose a call would have resolved the issue at some point. I enabled private/secure Internet-sharing via Wi-Fi on my laptop to provide my iPhone with faster connectivity than 3G (although 3G seemed to work very well all around the city). The Business Center is near some of the meeting rooms and is operated by the contracted audio-visual company. Available 24-hours by room-key and then payment by credit card, it was not staffed during the day when we entered, but rather a sign said to contact the operator for assistance, which I assume would then have the staff paged. Equipment included 3 PCs (MPC-brand, so not very new but OK), a mid-size color-capable copier, and a multifunction device as a fax machine. A laptop station is also available to get online via Ethernet and printing via USB or Parallel. Rates are comparable to other luxury hotels; workstation rental is 75Â¢/minute with a 10-minute minimum, printing is $1/page b/w and $1.75 color, copies are 30Â¢ or less depending on volume, and faxes are $5/page domestic. A separate PC with printer is available and provided complimentary by the hotel for airline boarding pass printing. We rented a car at the hotel via Concierge and it is quite convenient. Rather than pay the $70/night parking fee (we never saw a parking lot), we rented and returned the car the same day. Even with last minute notice, Concierge was able to obtain a car for us within about an hour. They use Hertz, and have you provide your cc and license, then they complete the paperwork and have you sign the contract when the car is delivered and waiting for you at the front entrance. You walk out, show your contract to the doorman, and the car is right there waiting for you. When you return, they make sure the car is not dinged, etc., take your contract, and you're done. I highly recommend renting a car for at least a day if you are flying in as you can drive to Golden Gate, drive down Lombard street, and even cruise up to wine country, all in an afternoon. Taxi is about $45 including tip from SFO, so better to do that R/T and rent the car from the hotel for a day. Our rental was about $85 for a Mustang convertible (we didn't specify car except to request a standard car). A very friendly and helpful doorman was the only one to repeatedly call us by our last name during our stay. No big deal, but I know that is important to Ritz. On the other hand, almost everyone here said hello as we passed by and made us feel welcome. We mostly ate out, but had drinks at the Lobby Lounge once, and it was "raw night" where they offered a variety of oysters, shrimp, and crab (not everything was raw). We left our camera by accident, and our nice server had it held for us by security which is a standard procedure. Concierge left a message in our room and one call had it delivered to our room by a hotel manager. Good and honest staff and appreciated of course. We enjoyed the heated pool one day, as well as the much more heated jacuzzi. There was only one other family of 3 using it at the time we went, around 4 PM. We had full access to the locker rooms which have private lockers, nice showers, etc. The adjacent fitness center shares the locker rooms. The bathroom was nice, but not spectacular. No separate shower stall in our room as is required by AAA 5-Diamond standards. Nice shower, none-the-less, and nice Bvlgari amenities. Slippers and robes are in the room. A bathroom scale is also in the room, and an important convenience if you want to weigh your luggage to be within airline weight restrictions. Large enough lighted closet had a good supply of hangers and included an iron and ironing board and built-in free safe. TV was modern and a DVD player is in the below cabinet as well as a game controller for paid games. We did not find a channel that described the hotels outlets or services, nor did we find a written sample menu and description and hours of the restaurants, etc. Maybe we missed them? Free daily delivery of Wall Street Journal and USA Today Overall, we had a nice stay. No super "wow factor" but for the most part, everything was positive including the staff. Very convenient to nearby shopping, restaurants, cable-car, etc and taxis are always waiting too. Good exercise up the hill after shopping and dinner especially when pushing a stroller!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice luxury hotel in the heart of San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Tcars
Reviews.Content: I very recently stayed 3 nights at the Ritz while attending a conference at the hotel; and the overall experience was very good. I felt it was a good value at the rates we were given for attending the conference. My only real complaint is with the street noise that I could hear at all hours of the day. I had a 3rd story room that was located along the very steep and busy Pine Street. I believe the windows are single pane and the traffic noise was a issue. Try to get either a higher floor or get a room away from Pine Street. Otherwise the hotel is pretty much what you would expect from a high end property. Also with most hotels the bottled water, soda, and beer in the mini bar is very expensive so be sure to stock up prior to arriving.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for a couple of nights - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MM_GB
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, in a good location for San Fran sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: jshayden
Reviews.Content: You can't ever go wrong with the Ritz-Carlton. Dinner at the The Dining Room was great and had a nice quiet atmosphere, lunch at The Lobby Lounge was nice too, the food. It was hard to eat outside of the hotel because the food was so good. As usual staff was always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service the moment we drove up”
Reviews.Author: Daniele454
Reviews.Content: I just can't believe a fine hotel franchise would have such inferior service as what my family experienced on our stay. Though the furnishings were beautiful that was the only good thing about the hotel. The valet was so flustered by his job he was incredibly rude and the manager did little to make our stay better. After we left this hotel we stayed at a Marriot in Portland and the service there was amazing. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: WharfTrader
Reviews.Content: stayed for one night - typical Ritz Carlton experience - excellent staff, well trained and welcoming - stayed on Club Level - Club Level lounge very nice - lovely snacks all day, a great place to relax after a day of sightseeing - room was nice, though a little 'chintzy' - very comfy bed with enough pillows for a dozen beds - bathroom nice size - shower nice, with Bulgari toiletries ( a small thing, but a nice touch) - plenty of towels - location good, just above union Square, though it is at the top of a steep hill. i checked out early but had a late flight - hotel had no problem with me using the Club Lounge all day on and off - Concierge was very friendly, helped me find tickets for the ball game without using a rip off ticket broker - all small touches but thats why people come back to RC chain

Reviews.Title: “The CrÃ¨me de la CrÃ¨me”
Reviews.Author: TravelCritic_9
Reviews.Content: The Ritz! San Francisco's finest. Life can't get any better. A stately exterior--a beautiful and elegant interior--an ambiance that shouts "exclusive luxury." That's The Ritz. Guests are warmly greeted upon arrival by a well-trained, attentive staff and offered a glass of champagne, my favorite beverage--how thoughtful. Everything was perfect from beginning to end. Ambiance and service met every expectation. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great but not outstanding in any area.”
Reviews.Author: csmac
Reviews.Content: I will avoid repeating much of the information already offered in the many reviews already published. This is my additional 2Â¢-worth. Stayed for one week in a 1-bed suite in the R-C SF in September 2009. Located at the top of one of SF's more challenging hills, the RC SF is away from much of the city centre's noise. If, like me, middle age is taking its toll, you can maintain your dignity by ascending the hill by cable car: there is stop right by the hotel. Good points: The hotel is immaculate: spotlessly clean, everything well-maintained, and largely tastefully decorated (though with perhaps too much yellow used in the guest rooms.) The welcome was friendly in an over-rehearsed way usual to top-class US hotels. Assistance with bags was offered, and names used throughout. The room was of a good size, well laid out and, apart from a couple of criticisms outlined below, perfect for our stay. The club lounge is an excellent idea, offering 4 food "presentations" (their buzzword, not mine) throughout the day, including an excellent breakfast offering and concierge service. Less good: The room had a slight foody odour. I never did work out the cause. On one morning, a workman was clambering about on the roof at 07:20! As we were on the top floor, the noise was highly intrusive. A complaint to the management led to their immediate offer of reducing the bill by one night's room charge and tax. Impressive. Other negatives are minor: Wifi was free but poor reception; the colour yellow was over-used in the room; the Bose iPod dock in the living room should have been matched in the bedroom - does anyone still carry CDs with them? There was often a tang of cigar smoke in one of the corridors. On the whole, a comfortable, relaxing and surprisingly well-priced stay. I have no qualms about recommending the hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: sanchoCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Very happy with our recent stay at the Ritz Calrton. Very friendly staff and are eager to make your stay comfortable. This was our second stay at a Ritz Carlton (Lake Las Vegas was the other). My kids loved the indoor pool. My 8 year old only wants to stay in 5 star hotels now.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: moeavatane
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because thay had a package deal with tickets to see King Tut and I wasn't dissapointed. A nice couple blocks from Chinatown, and easy directions to the de young museum to see Tut. Typical Ritz Carlton with always a beautiful smile when they see you. Beautiful little indoor pool that my kids enjoyed. Piles of pillows on the beds, and the soft sheets are dreamy. We didn't eat at the hotel as we wanted authentic Chinese, but we all loved the hotel and staff. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: ssabo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my hubby for three nights last week and loved the hotel. We are retired military to got a really good rate! Interior view room on the 6th floor of the courtyard was very quiet. The room was spacious (a regular room,) and nicely appointed. We used the gym and pool/hot tub one morning and it was a very nice facility. All of the employees were super nice even though you could tell we aren't the normal Ritz guests (jeans and sneakers...) They directed us to a good local parking garage ($32 vs the $62 at the hotel,) yummy pizza at Uncle Vito's, and were able to answer any questions we had. The location was perfect! Short walk to Union Square (take the cable car back up, the hill is steep,) China town and North beach, many good local restaurants You can get the cable car at any corner and the Powell Mason line car is less crowded to you can probably get on easier. Don't wait at the turnaround area! We would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Missing the small things”
Reviews.Author: bobonyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz in SF over the weekend with my family (3 kids) we stayed in an executive suite. Tried to check in early but the room wasn't ready so we went for a walk and came back only to find the room still not ready even though it was 30min past check-in. Everyone is tired so we have tea (which was good) and wait for another 30min for our room. The room is nice, it's clean and decent but this shouldn't be a surprise we're at a Ritz. My wife wanted to take our girls for a pedicure, as it turns out the Spa can't service more than 1 person at a time...yes that's what we were told. Also we wanted to have dinner at the restaurant ...oh the restaurant is is closed on Sunday. There's a lot to like about the hotel it's in a good location , the staff are friendly but at these prices there's too much competition in San Francisco and too many holes both in the services provided or should I say not provide.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, but no "wow" factor”
Reviews.Author: momoftwo_NJ
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 4 nights at the Ritz Carlton SF. This hotel is located in a perfect location for sightseeing - close to most attractions and yet away from all the traffic/noise. The room was nicely appointed and the service was good. It is located on top of a very steep hill, but we used it to our advantage. We walked down to nearby restaurants for dinner and hike up the hill. By the time we reached our room, we weren't so stuffed anymore. :-) The suite we stayed was spacious and appreciated all the closet space. However, as a previous reviewer had stated, this property lacked the "wow" factor and is not one of our memorable properties like FS Maui or FS Hualalai. Granted that it is a hotel in a city, not a resort, it may not be a fair comparison. But while the amenities were good and staff was friendly, a certain element was missing. It's hard to put a finger on it, but I think it'd be best to summarize it as attention to little details. Here, we felt the staff was courteous (probably because they were trained to do so) but they didn't really go out of their way to help us. For example, there is a greeter at the front door who stands there and say "have a nice day". One morning, while waiting for our car outside, I realized I wanted to ask a question to Concierge. When I ran back into the hotel, the same gentleman who had just greeted me less than 2 minutes ago didn't recognize me and said the same perfunctory "have a nice day". One more example, the suite had a nice coffeemaker right at the door. So, one evening, I decided to brew a cup, only to realize that the water reservoir in the coffeemaker was not clean at all (it was actually filthy!). Ritz Carlton SF was a great hotel for our trip. Would we stay here again when we're in SF? Probably. Did we leave feeling "I can't wait until I come back here again"? No. And I think that's the difference that sets those "memorable" hotels apart.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on the Hill”
Reviews.Author: travelduck111
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in San Francisco and at the Ritz. The hotel was luxurious, in a great location, and - hold on to your feathers - reasonably priced. Yes, I gave the hotel five stars (quacks) as it was everything as expected. But, I have to say that I agree with some previous reviews that it was missing that certain "wow" factor. While it was certainly Ritz quality, I would not necessarily remember this hotel as I would other properties, i.e. the Four Seasons Maui. I was lucky to pay $169/night on the website but honestly I would have been disappointed had I paid a rack rate of over $300/night. Please enjoy everyone's favorite Travel Duck tips below: 1. I would highly suggest taking a cab to this hotel from SFO - don't even mess with BART. A cab should cost $37 before tip. It should take about 25 minutes from SFO (or in our case 15 minutes since the taxi driver was an absolute madman!) 2. The hotel is almost at the top of Nob Hill. Folks, if you have never been to San Francisco before, bring your walking shoes, the hill is very very steep. The location of the hotel is in a high-class area, away from the touristy areas of Fisherman's Wharf and Union Square. But, an easy walk to Chinatown which is about 2 blocks away. 3. I would highly recommend touring the city using the Cable Cars - which stop right outside of the entrance to the hotel. Take the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf or down the Hill to the Union Square/Embarcedero area. Buy a day pass for $11 which lets you ride the cable cars and light rail all day. If you care to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, go straight up Stockton street for a nice 20 minute walk with few hills. 4. Okay, the reason why I advised you to walk straight up Stockton Street is that you MUST go to Mama's for breakfast which is at 1701 Stockton by Washington Square. The place is cash only, small, opens at 8:00 a.m. (closed Mon) but has won the award for the best breakfast in San Francisco. Make sure you are in line by around 7:30 or 7:45 at the latest. I would recommend one of the huge omelettes or the french toast with fresh fruit. It certainly beats the expensive room service or buffet at the hotel. Yes, room service at the Ritz is very expensive, $21 for a hamburger, add $4 if you want cheese on it. 5. Oh, all this talk about food makes me forget that I am reviewing the hotel :) We had a room on the 3rd floor which is actually one level below the lobby level. It overlooked the courtyard and was perfectly nice. Again, it did not blow me away but I am not complaining for $169/night. The bath was marble and had excellent shampoos and lotions. I think my wife took some samples on the way out. 6. You cannot go to San Francisco without having Deem (Dim) Sum. Where is the best Deem Sum you ask? It is hands-down at Yank Sing at 101 Spear Street in the financial district (not in Chinatown). You are seated and welcomed with little carts of dumplings, rolls, etc. traveling through the restaurant. Pick what you like and the waiters keep track of your bill on a little card which kind of looks like a bingo card. A word of warning, while extremely delicious, it is costly and the waiters are a bit aggressive. For instance, one piece of sea bass is $16. Most dumplings are between $5-$8. 7. For a great dinner on Nob Hill, I would highly recommend Nob Hill Cafe at Washington and Taylor Streets. It is a small little Italian restaurant which was packed with locals and visitors alike. We had the gnocchi bolognese and the chicken parm which were fantastic and reasonably priced under $20. 8. Are you still reading and taking notes? How would you like to spend a day in Napa/Sonoma on a wine tasting tour? Many of travelers book one of the tour buses which take you to a few commercial wineries in Napa. Not this (travel) duck. I found an amazing gentleman, Mike, who will pick you up at your hotel in San Francisco, drive you to Napa taking you to excellent wineries, and drop you back at your hotel for $30/hour. He took us to a small family owned winery where we had a private tour and even sampled some wine right out the barrel. We had a private tasting at another winery where we sampled at least ten wines for $10/each. He also took us to a gourmet market where we picked up sandwiches for a picnic lunch with a nice view. Mike is a wealth of knowledge about wine and will spend time speaking with you before the trip to ensure that you have a day to remember on your private tour. He even let me sit up front when I felt a little car sick on the ride over. Send me a message if you would like his contact information as he does not have a website. 9. Make sure you check out the "Painted Ladies" which are some remarkable houses on Alamo Square in the Haight-Ashbury area. You need to take a cab or get ready for a nice long 45 walk from the hotel. 10. Are you still reading? Of course, you are probably wondering how this travel duck person gets a $169 rate at the Ritz, takes a private winery tour for $30 hour, and eats at the best breakfast, deem sum, and italian restaurants in the city. Well, I do my research and am happy to share my findings with my fellow travelers. Feel free to send me an e-mail if you have any other questions. 11. If you are planning on touring Alcatraz, make sure you book the tour in advance. A lot of the tours were sold out when we got there. I hear that the nighttime tour is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: oepp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for the first 3 nights of our honeymoon after much research. It is in a great location close to Union Square although your legs get a good workout on the way home. Staff are friendly, rooms spacious for a city hotel, very clean and beautifully decorated. Spa facilities lovely and quiet both times we went there. If we had to mention bad points, it was a little on the impersonal side compared to other places we stayed at on our honeymoon but I guess that is to be expected in a big city. The concierge recommended a steak house for us to eat at and it was distinctly average, do your own research on restaurants......there are so many good ones out there! Overall would we stay here again? Yes....in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Feel good as soon as you walk in the door”
Reviews.Author: Getawayguy20
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. Right from the moment we walked in, we were given the best of service. In fact, within a minute of being escorted to the reception area, we had a complimentary glass of champagne in each of our hands. Our room was ready early, we had an inside garden view which was fine and very quiet. Great breakfasts, good pool and hot tub for relaxing after a long day of walking. Easy access to Chinatown, Union Square, the Cable Cars, and about a 30 minute walk to Pier 39 and the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Club Lounge”
Reviews.Author: kateinthesun
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in, we were offered champagne. We thought it was a great way to begin our vacation after a 5.5 hour flight from Miami with our children. We booked a 1-bedroom suite at Club Level. The Suite was comfortable; furnished in classic Ritz Carlton style. The 9th Floor was exceptionally quiet. The Club Concierges were helpful when sought out, but not overly friendly. I thought the Club attendants Annalyn and Max, warmer, and more personable. The food and beverage presentations were truly excellent at this property. I had high expectations and they were exceeded. I have to say that many of the offerings were not suitable for children, but we asked for, and received, mac and cheese, hot dogs and chicken fingers on a few occasions. This was provided as a gracious concession by the Concierge Team, and we did appreciate it. However, I feel there should be a Kids Club Menu as a standard amenity. Nothing elaborate, just a few favourite items. I found the Concierge Team on the Reception Floor of the Hotel to be incredibly aloof. On more than one occasion, I had to wait for 2 Concierges to complete conversations with each other, before turning towards me. Questions were answered with the bare minimum of attention, and I thought this quality of service unusual for a Ritz Carlton property. Housekeeping service is very good at this Hotel. Discreet, yet efficient. I dislike returning to my room in the middle of the day and finding it unserviced. This never happened during our 5-night stay. We used the Hotel's Pool with our children.
